Class FloorColor

  • java.lang.Object
    • mods.AbstractMod
      • mods.FloorColor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Emulateable

    public class FloorColor
extends AbstractMod
implements Emulateable
    Author:
    arno A Floor Color module. Can compute mean color of an Image and comparing it to reference colors/points

      • getMeanColorFromFile

        public BiMap.MyEntry<java.lang.Integer> getMeanColorFromFile(java.io.File file)
        Computes the mean color of the Image. Area Averaging/JPEG Optimizations of DC-Blocks make this a simple approach.
        Parameters:
        file - The Image to be worked with

      • getEstimates

        public LocationEstimationVector getEstimates(long timeStamp1,
                                    long timeStamp2)
        Description copied from interface: Emulateable
        Returns estimates on the Position of the user/device ! The mod itself has to decide if an entry of its data may fit better to the actual or next timestamp ! For example dataTimeStamp = 80, timeStamp1 = 1, timeStamp2 = 81 -> Should decide that dataTimeStamp is not used in most cases.
        Specified by:
        getEstimates in interface Emulateable
        Parameters:
        timeStamp1 - the actual concerning TimeStamp (FP-based)
        timeStamp2 - the upcoming TimeStamp (FP-Based)
        Returns:
        Estimates of the position

      • distanceOf

        private java.lang.Double distanceOf(BiMap.MyEntry<java.lang.Integer> myEntry,
                          BiMap.MyEntry<java.lang.Integer> myEntry2)
        Computes the euclidiean distance between two images (in fact the distance of the 3-dimensional RGB-Domain)
        Parameters:
        myEntry - One RGB-representation of an image
        myEntry2 - Another RGB-representation of an image
        Returns:
        the euclidean distance between those representationt in the RGB Space
